alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 03 at 6:31PM MDT until May 08 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Utah... Green River near Jensen affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures have accelerated snow melt across the high country of northeast Utah and northwest Colorado. This is increases flow on many tributaries of the Green River, with a forecast peak in river levels expected this weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Green River near Jensen. * WHEN...From this evening to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Impacts...At 9.0 feet, the Green River reaches bankfull resulting in minor flooding of low-lying agricultural land and potential for bank erosion. At 9.5 feet, minor lowland flooding occurs along the Green River. For agricultural land near the river, irrigation and a few out buildings could be impacted. At 10.8 feet, the Green River reaches flood stage. Irrigation pumps and any equipment near the river would be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 10.0 feet early Saturday morning. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
